AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Garcia: case involving the use of the Allen charge in trials and the smuggling of undocumented aliens, with jury instructions emphasizing the importance of reaching a verdict after approximately 2 hours of deliberation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.5th Circuit Court of Appeals: court where the appeal regarding the Allen charge is being considered and has repeatedly upheld the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that refused to conduct a post-verdict hearing on whether the jury was coerced by the Allen charge and instructed the jury to continue deliberation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: defendant in a trial related to illegal alien smuggling, appealing the use of the Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge TATE: dissenting judge in the case of United States v. Garcia, questioning the lawfulness of certain actions based on speculation about poor and dirty Hispanic appearing persons being Mexican aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.modified Allen charge: a form of jury instruction used in the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals, considered permissible within certain limitations, given to the jury in Maria De Jesus Garcia's trial
